intro: Diabelia spathulata var. spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf diabelia, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in cymes, which are often fragrant. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
